paragraphs.name: cf33
paragraphs.text: A Prolegomena to any Future Politics

paragraphs.name: 4a1e
paragraphs.text: The following are a series of assertions around our present geo-political circumstances and hypotheses about our most effective actions.

paragraphs.name: a787
paragraphs.text: There is a global institutional order, largely initiated as the aftermath of WWII and growing organically through to the fall of the Eastern Bloc, at which point it substantially accelerated. This order includes both active and passive interconnections that span economic, technological, social, cultural, political and military dimensions. By “institutional order” is meant the organizational and conceptual mechanisms by which human activities are focused and directed. This includes governmental organizations (the US Military, the EU ministry of agriculture, medicare), meta governmental organizations (the UN, the WTO, the IMF), NGOs, corporations, etc.

paragraphs.name: a803
paragraphs.text: This global institutional order was largely formulated based on the technical and conceptual state of the art existing after WWII. Although it has consistently been complexified and updated (“patched”) in the intervening 60 years, it is still fundamentally organized around hows, whats and whys that originate in that era.

The foundation on which this order was built and by which it made sense has been undergoing profound transformation — particularly in the past two decades. Largely, this is the result of the unprecedented *success* of the present order: advances in information technology, increases in population, depletion of global natural resources, etc.

paragraphs.name: e228
paragraphs.text: Whenever an institutional order is faced with this kind of transformation of its fundament, it can choose two paths:

paragraphs.name: ee53
paragraphs.text: Deconstruct and reorganize functions around emerging capabilities
Attempt to conserve the existing order

The former choice involves significant pain. Disrupting existing means (and even ends) is contra human psychological tendencies. Moreover, it is not guaranteed to be successful — many things can happen when long-bound energies are released in an institutional reconstruction. As a consequence, it requires tremendous foresight and political will.

paragraphs.name: 2b54
paragraphs.text: The latter choice ultimately involves the death of the society. An attempt to conserve an order that has become obsolete requires an intensification of “delusional” mechanisms that distance society from reality and eventually deplete its ability to operate. Thus society moves from productive to conservative to moribund. Depending on the political will and political power of the institutions driving the transition from productive to conservative, this death can be very quick and destructive (see French Revolution) or can potentially be delayed for a very long time (“zombieification”). Indeed, the period just following the transition from productive to conservative (open to closed) can be experienced as highly positive (a “golden age”). However, once a society moves to full closure — like any entropic environment — its fate is (largely, although never absolutely) sealed.

paragraphs.name: df65
paragraphs.text: The decision to deconstruct and reorganize can rarely (never?) be made by existing institutions (the past), it must, instead, be made by “institutions from the future” — which can provide solutions and vision that is simply outside of the means of existing institutions.

paragraphs.name: fbba
paragraphs.text: It is possible to interpolate the shape of future institutional orders based on the present circumstances.

paragraphs.name: 35c4
paragraphs.text: Uniquely in history, our future institutional order must be self-assembling, self-organizing and meta-stable. There can be no central organizing structure that is adequate to their construction — instead they must be architected to “unfold” dynamically yet effectively.

paragraphs.name: ba13
paragraphs.text: Nonetheless, we can assert several rules that are quite likely to be part of their basic operations:

paragraphs.name: 903a
paragraphs.text: - Data aware: in principle all possible transactions are stored and searchable

paragraphs.name: c8d8
paragraphs.text: - Transparent: in principle all transactions can be viewed by all participants

paragraphs.name: b929
paragraphs.text: - Distributed: in principle no levels of hierarchy

paragraphs.name: c10f
paragraphs.text: - Anti-fragile: designed to maximize and benefit from “black swan” events rather than minimize and suffer from them

paragraphs.name: 32af
paragraphs.text: - Auto-liberating: intrinsically difficult to capture and all efforts to capture are rendered ruinous
- Transient. Beyond the basic resilient holon and stored data, every function or organization is built with the time or conditions that warrant its death built into the design/plan.

paragraphs.name: db32
paragraphs.text: The new system must run concurrently with the old in order to avoid inducing general collapse. To achieve this end:

paragraphs.name: ed7e
paragraphs.text: 1) It displaces due to choice and not force. Bit by bit and not all at once.

paragraphs.name: 1e0e
paragraphs.text: 2) It can leverage mature services of the old system to gain capabilities rapidly and supplement deficits.

paragraphs.name: e3ab
paragraphs.text: 3) It must be able to defend itself against predation by the old system.

paragraphs.name: edb2
paragraphs.text: 4) It replaces old system functions when able.

paragraphs.name: 9b90
paragraphs.text: 5) Connection to the new system is a function of desire/membership and a willingness to live by a set of rules, both at the individual level and at the level of the resilient community. Membership is not based on geography or accident of birth, it is earned through behavior.
